title: Particle motion along parametricly def. path part - e

content.description: During the time period from t = 0 to t = 6 seconds, a particle moves along the path given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mi>cos</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiEaiaacI cacaWG0bGaaiykaiabg2da9iaaiodaciGGJbGaai4BaiaacohacaGG OaGaeqiWdaNaamiDaiaacMcaaaa@41EA@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>=</mo> <mn>5</mn> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyEaiaacI cacaWG0bGaaiykaiabg2da9iaaiwdaciGGZbGaaiyAaiaac6gacaGG OaGaeqiWdaNaamiDaiaacMcaaaa@41F2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.
content.question: Write and evaluate an integral expression, in terms of sine and cosine, that gives the distance the particle travels from t = 1.25 and t = 1.75 .

frqParts.text: Write and evaluate an integral expression, in terms of sine and cosine, that gives the distance the particle travels from t = 1.25 and t = 1.75 .

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
